result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason E. Dunkin-Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Deft may petition for expungement after one year if fine and restitution have been paid in full.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Jason E. Dunkin-Scott, appeared with Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Clerk: PT
Amended Information filed by the State.  Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  Deft. pleads Guilty as amended; found guilty by the Court.  PSI is waived by parties.  Sentencing arguments made.  Court imposes a fine of $500 plus costs including DNA surcharge.  Cash Bond on deposit shall be applied.  Restitution in the amount of $4082.47 ordered joint and several with co-defendant if not already paid.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning and Voting Acknowledgement given.  DE may petition for expungement after one year if fine and restitution have been paid in full.
Final pre-trial on December 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.
